We are hiring and want to hear from you. Apply Now jobs Our history All your friends are here Big John’s Tavern is Charleston’s oldest tavern in one of America’s oldest towns. This rustic bar is full of history and has seen more than its fair share of lore that has grown over the years. If walls could talk there would be no shortage of stories. Some fact and some fiction, and some aged like a fine bourbon that gets better with time. Ask us about Big John Cannady, who played for the New York Giants from 1947-1954, before opening Big John's Tavern in 1955, in his hometown of Charleston, SC. Read more about us Reviews review by - Yelp Martha N: best service! great food! fun people! local! A must for locals and visitors!please leave a space for me review by - Yelp Leigh B: Stopped in for a glass of wine and decided to order a turkey burger. It was THE BEST turkey burger I have ever had - and I have had a lot of turkey burgers!Nice,local neighborhood spot. Recommend and I look forward to coming back for the turkey burger. review by - Yelp Samantha M: Will and andres provided the best service in Charleston! So welcoming and the craft cocktails are so unique. Big John's is a must and make sure to check out the speak easy!! review by - Yelp Amber M: This place is great. Live music, red leather bar stools, friendly bartenders. What else could you ask for? review by - Yelp Michael R: Great bar with incredible selections. Don't sleep on the food. Everything was fantastic, but I specifically loved the steak tartare.
